The model part gains Fury, Hatred while joined to one or more Rank-and-File models with Human.

wdg-beacon_of_the_dark_gods.title: Beacon of the Dark Gods
wdg-beacon_of_the_dark_gods.def: the Wizard knows one additional spell, chosen from:Whispers of the Veil=free,Danse Macabre=free,Molten Copper=free,Wrath of God*=free*only if Wizard Master

wdg-wings.title: Wings
wdg-wings.def: The model’s Mobility is set to 8", and it gains Fly.

wdg-manifestation.title: Manifestation
wdg-manifestation.def:
During Pre-game Selections, each Exalted Herald must choose two different Manifestations from the list below and apply the effects during the game.
The model must select two spells out of those indicated for the chosen Manifestations, Wrath of God (Thaumaturgy), and Hellfire (Hereditary Spell) (this replaces the normal rules for Spell Selection connected to being a Wizard Adept).

wdg-dying_embers.title: Dying Embers
wdg-dying_embers.def:
- Attack Attribute



After using the Breath Attack, the model loses a Health Point (with no saves of any kind allowed).

wdg-primal_legend.title: Primal Legend
wdg-primal_legend.def:
While the model is on the Battlefield, friendly units cannot use Fly for Move Manoeuvres or Charge Moves.
In addition, if the model is the General, the maximum sum of Legendary Beasts values in the army is increased by 1.

wdg-damnation.title: Damnation
wdg-damnation.def:
The unit gains Solitary.
If it fails a Break Test, after taking Panic Tests, replace each model of the unit with a Wretched One model:
  • The unit and its models are considered removed as a casualties.
  • Each Wretched One model is placed in the same position and facing the same direction as the model it replaces (even if the replaced model was in contact with an enemy unit: in this case, the Wretched One model is placed in contact with the enemy unit, too).
  • The Wretched One models form a new unit.
  • The Wretched One unit follows the rules for Summoned Units, except that it ignores the Unit Spacing rule when placed on the Battlefield, but can still not overlap other units or Impassible Terrain.
  • The Wretched One unit cannot perform any Combat Reforms in the Round of Combat during which it is Summoned. Enemy units can do so as normal.
  • Note that the following Round of Combat is not considered the First Round of Combat for the Wretched One unit, nor for the enemy units it is Engaged with.

wdg-gateway.title: Gateway
wdg-gateway.def:
During Pre-game Selections, mark a point on the Battlefield within 24" of your Deployment Zone and outside the opponent’s Deployment Zone with a Gateway Marker.
There can never be more than 4 friendly Gateway Markers on the Battlefield.
If a Gateway Marker is removed, then all units within 3" of the marker suffer 3D3 hits with Toxic Attacks.
Remove all friendly Gateway Markers if there are no friendly Hellmaws or friendly models with a Veilgate Orb on the Battlefield ,at the end of any phase.

At the start of each friendly Magic Phase, if this model was allowed to move during the preceding Movement Phase (ie. it is not shaken, did not Ambush, Fail Charge, is Unengaged etc.), you can apply one of the following effects:
  • Mark a single point on the Battlefield within 24" of the model with a Gateway Marker.
Before doing so, you may remove from the Battlefield a friendly Gateway Marker that was not placed during this Player Turn.
  • Target a single friendly unit within 9" of the model, not containing any model of Height 5, and that was allowed to move in the preceding Movement Phase (ie. it is not shaken, did not Ambush, Fail Charge, is Unengaged etc.). Remove the unit from the Battlefield and immediately place it back on the Battlefield, in the same formation, with Ambush(friendly Gateway Marker, that was not placed during this Player Turn).

wdg-big_brother.title: Big Brother
wdg-big_brother.def: The model’s HP are set to 9, its base size is changed to 75×100 mm, and the roll for the number of hits it does with its Stomp Attack is Maximised.

wdg-giant_club.title: Giant Club
wdg-giant_club.def:
- Melee Weapon

+1 Str, +1 AP.

+1 Str, +1 AP.

wdg-monstrous_familiar.title: Monstrous Familiar
wdg-monstrous_familiar.def: The model gains Wizard Conclave(1), and chooses its spells from the following spells:Living Steel=free,Corruption of Tin=free,Hellfire=free

wdg-tribal_warspear.title: Tribal Warspear
wdg-tribal_warspear.def:
- Melee Weapon

+1 Str, Multiple Wounds(D3, towards Height 4--5).
The wielder is an Attachable Model and gains Exclusive(Barbarians).
No more than a single model with Tribal Warspear can ever be joined to the same unit..

+1 Str, Multiple Wounds(D3, towards Height 4--5).

The wielder is an Attachable Model and gains Exclusive(Barbarians).
No more than a single model with Tribal Warspear can ever be joined to the same unit..

wdg-release_the_hounds.title: Release the Hounds
wdg-release_the_hounds.def: One use only. Duration: End of Turn. Can be activated at the start of any friendly Player Turn: the unit gains +2 Mob and Devastating Charge(+1 Att, +1 Str).

wdg-additional_limbs.title: Additional Limbs
wdg-additional_limbs.def: The model’s Mobility is set to 10", and its Armour is set to 3.

wdg-meeting_of_minds.title: Meeting of Minds
wdg-meeting_of_minds.def: When initiating a Move Manoeuvre, the model can choose to lose Fly and gain +2 Mobility. Duration: One Phase.

wdg-writhing_mass.title: Writhing Mass
wdg-writhing_mass.def: When in the second rank and not in Contact with any enemy model, the model can make Grind Attack across models in the first rank directly in front of it.

wdg-trophy_rack.title: Trophy Rack
wdg-trophy_rack.def:
The model may take a single Banner Enchantment (using the bearer's Special Item allowance as normal).

In addition, once per Round of Combat, when an enemy unit Engaged with the model's unit is Destroyed in Combat or removed as a casualty in the Melee Phase, the bearer gains Resolute(+1).

wdg-veil_walker.title: Veil Walker
wdg-veil_walker.def: The Caster gains +1 to cast Learned Spells with type: Damage.

wdg-battle_fever.title: Battle Fever
wdg-battle_fever.def: Units containing a model with Battle Fever must reroll failed Courage Tests.

wdg-hellforged_armour.title: Hell-Forged Armour
wdg-hellforged_armour.def: The wearer's model gains Resistance(Toxic Attacks).

wdg-spiked_shield.title: Spiked Shield
wdg-spiked_shield.def:
Shield.
When a Height 1--3 model uses a Hand Weapon and is Using a Spiked Shield simultaneously, and the bearer successfully passes an Armour Save roll on a 4+ against an enemy Melee Attack, from a model Engaged in its Front Facing, the bearer immediately inflicts 1 hit with its Str and AP towards the model that caused the wound, before any casualties are removed.

wdg-brand_of_the_dragon.title: Brand of the Dragon
wdg-brand_of_the_dragon.def: Fly,Light Troops,Swiftstride,Breath Attack(Str 4, AP 1, Flaming Attacks)

wdg-unholy_avatar.title: Unholy Avatar
wdg-unholy_avatar.def: +1 Strength, +1 Armour Penetration, and Divine Attacks

wdg-entropic_aura.title: Entropic Aura
wdg-entropic_aura.def:
Weapon Enchantments and Armour Enchantments carried by the bearer, by models in the bearer’s unit, and by models in units that are in contact with the bearer are ignored and ceases to be Enchanted.
Note: The weapon still provides its mundane effects.

wdg-luck_of_the_dark_gods.title: Luck of the Dark Gods
wdg-luck_of_the_dark_gods.def: The bearer’s model gains Aegis(+1, max. 4+).

wdg-idol_of_spite.title: Idol of Spite
wdg-idol_of_spite.def: One use only. May be activated when Choosing Equipment and Abilities: the bearer gains +1 Att, +1 Str, and +1 AP, with Duration: Round of Combat.

wdg-dark_prelate.title: Dark Prelate
wdg-dark_prelate.def: The bearer can cast Blood Curse (Occultism) and Pentagram of Pain (Occultism) as a Bound Spell(5+).

wdg-envy.title: Envy
wdg-envy.def: Charge Range and Pursue Distance rolls by units containing this Favour are Maximised.

wdg-gluttony.title: Gluttony
wdg-gluttony.def: The first time a model with this Favour is on the winning side of a combat, its model parts with Path of the Favoured gains +1 Str. Duration: Permanent.

wdg-greed.title: Greed
wdg-greed.def:
The model part with Path of the Favoured gains Great Weapon, Halberd, Paired Weapons, and Weapon Master.
A Chosen Lord with this Favour may take a second item from either the Artefacts category or the Potions and Scrolls category (but cannot take a second item from both categories).

wdg-lust.title: Lust
wdg-lust.def: The model gains Feigned Flight, Strider.

wdg-pride.title: Pride
wdg-pride.def:
The model gains Disciplined.
Courage Tests taken by units containing this Favour are Minimised.

wdg-sloth.title: Sloth
wdg-sloth.def:
Model gains Aegis(6+).
In addition, if the model is Height it gains Aegis(+1, max. 4+, against no Armour Save*).

*Can only be used for attacks against which the model cannot take or would automatically fail its Armour Saves.

wdg-wrath.title: Wrath
wdg-wrath.def: Model parts with Path of the Favoured gains First Strike(Hatred).

wdg-legendary_beasts.title: Legendary Beasts
wdg-legendary_beasts.def: The sum of the Legendary Beasts values stated in brackets of all models in the army is restricted to 1 per 750 Army Points (rounding fractions up).

wdg-hellfire.title: Hellfire
wdg-hellfire.def:
The target suffers 2D6 hits with and Magical Attacks.

*This spell can target units Engaged in Combat and in contact with the Caster’s Front Facing.

wdg-burning_portent.title: Burning Portent
wdg-burning_portent.def: AP set to 10. Flaming Attacks, Multiple Wounds(D3),

wdg-icon_of_the_infinite.title: Icon of the Infinite
wdg-icon_of_the_infinite.def: The bearer can cast Hellfire (Hereditary Spell) as a Bound Spell(6+).

wdg-zealots_banner.title: Zealots’ Banner
wdg-zealots_banner.def: Models in the bearer’s unit gain Extra Support (3).

wdg-wasteland_torch.title: Wasteland Torch
wdg-wasteland_torch.def:
The bearer’s unit gains Strider (Ruins), First Strike(Flaming Attacks).

In addition, during Pre-game Selections, you may choose a single Field, Forest: the chosen Terrain Feature is changed to a Ruins, without changing size.

wdg-veilgate_orb.title: Veilgate Orb
wdg-veilgate_orb.def:
During Pre-game Selections, mark a point on the Battlefield within 24" of your Deployment Zone, and outside the opponent’s Deployment Zone, with a Gateway Marker.

One use only. At the start of a friendly Magic Phase, if the bearer’s unit was allowed to move in the preceding Movement Phase (ie. it is not Shaken, did not Ambush, did not fail a Charge, is Unengaged, etc.), you may remove it from the Battlefield and immediately place it back on the Battlefield with Ambush(friendly Gateway Marker, that was not placed during this Player Turn).

wdg-immortal_gauntlets.title: Immortal Gauntlets
wdg-immortal_gauntlets.def: When Choosing Equipment and Abilities, choose one of the following Attack Attributes for the wearer’s Melee Attacks: Divine Attacks, Flaming Attacks, Magical Attacks. Duration: Round of Combat.

wdg-lord_of_the_damned.title: Lord of the Damned
wdg-lord_of_the_damned.def: Before rolling the Random Movement distance in the Movement Phase, friendly units entirely with Irredeemable within 18" of the bearer may choose to apply either Minimised or Maximised to the roll.

wdg-wyrd_stone.title: Wyrd Stone
wdg-wyrd_stone.def: The bearer’s model gains Hard Target(2).

wdg-dark_familiar.title: Dark Familiar
wdg-dark_familiar.def: Learned Spells cast by the model part gain +6" Range (Aura spells gain +3" Range instead).

rulebook-artefacts.title: Artefacts
rulebook-artefacts.def: Artefacts are unique and powerful items that can have various effects. No additional rules apply to Artefacts.

rulebook-weapon_enchantments.title: Weapon Enchantments
rulebook-weapon_enchantments.def:
Weapon Enchantments are upgrades that enhance weapons. A weapon on which a Weapon Enchantment is applied becomes an Enchanted Weapon.
The Army List must indicate which weapon that the model is equipped with is an Enchanted Weapon (reminder: models are equipped with a Hand Weapon by default).

Each Weapon Enchantment can only enchant particular weapon types (e.g. Great Weapon) or a category of weapons (e.g. Melee Weapon).

The following rules apply to all Enchanted Weapons, unless specifically mentioned otherwise:

  • If a model is equipped with an Enchanted Weapon it must use it in Combat whenever possible.

  • All attacks made with the Enchanted Weapon gain Magical Attacks.

  • The Enchanted Weapon follows the rules for both its original weapon type and the Weapon Enchantment.

  • See the rules for weapons (Model Rules) for details on when to apply modifiers and additional rules.

rulebook-armour_enchantments.title: Armour Enchantments
rulebook-armour_enchantments.def:
These upgrades apply to pieces of armour carried by a model, and can in general be taken by any model. That model is then considered as wearing an Enchanted Armour.

If an Armour Enchantment is restricted to models with a minimum Armour value, for this purpose only consider the model’s part unmodified base Armour value (excluding mounts), the number written on its profile in the Army Book.

The following rules apply to all Armour Enchantments, unless specifically mentioned otherwise:

  • Characteristics modifiers, Model Rules, and all other rules associated with Armour Enchantments are generally only applied to the model part wearing the Enchanted Armour, and do not affect other model parts such as mounts. This includes modifiers to Global and Defensive Characteristics.

However, note that certain Model Rules, particularly Model Rules that are neither an Attack Attribute nor a weapon, are always applied to the combined model (and not only to individual model parts).

For example the Basalt Infusion provides +1 Arm and Aegis. +1 Arm is a Characteristic modifier, and is thus only applied to the Character wearing the Enchanted Armour.

If this Character rides a mount that has its own Armour value, the Armour modifier from Basalt Infusion has no effect on the combined model.

However, Aegis is a Global Model Rule, which means it is not applied to an individual model part, but to the whole combined model.

rulebook-shield_enchantments.title: Shield Enchantments
rulebook-shield_enchantments.def:
Shield Enchantments are upgrades that apply to Shields. An Enchanted Shield follows the rules for both the original Shield and the Shield Enchantment.

The following rules apply to all Shield Enchantments, unless specifically mentioned otherwise:

  • The effect of a Shield Enchantment only applies when the bearer of the Enchanted Shield is Using a Shield Shield (remember that a model part cannot use a Shield to protect against Melee Attacks when it is using a Two-Handed weapon in Combat).

  • Characteristic modifiers, Model Rules, and all other rules associated with Shield Enchantments follow the same rules as for Armour Enchantments.

rulebook-potions_and_scrolls.title: Potions and Scrolls
rulebook-potions_and_scrolls.def:
Potions and Scrolls are Magic Items that provide temporary effects when consumed by a model.

The following rules apply to all Potions and Scrolls, unless specifically mentioned otherwise:

  • One use only.

  • Potions and Scrolls can be activated at the start of any phase, or when Choosing Equipment and Abilities in a Round of Combat.

  • Duration: End of Turn.

  • Their effects (including Characteristic modifiers and Attack Attributes) are only applied to the model part taking the Magic Item, and do not affect other model parts such as mounts.

rulebook-banner_enchantments.title: Banner Enchantments
rulebook-banner_enchantments.def: Banner Enchantments are upgrades for Battle Standard Bearer and units containing a Standard Bearer, assuming these units have access to Magic Items (as indicated in their unit entry).

rulebook-replicable.title: Replicable
rulebook-replicable.def:
Multiple attempts at casting a Replicable spell can be made in the same Magic Phase without suffering the normal -3 modifier to the Casting Roll (or -1 in the case of Bound Spells).
Note that the spell still can not be attempted multiple times to be cast by the same Wizard.

rulebook-living_steel.title: Living Steel
rulebook-living_steel.def:
The target’s Melee Attacks gains +1 to hit and Magical Attacks .
No model can be affected by more than one instance of this spell simultaneously.

rulebook-corruption_of_tin.title: Corruption of Tin
rulebook-corruption_of_tin.def: The target suffers -1 Arm and gains Metal Armour.

rulebook-wall_of_lead.title: Wall of Lead
rulebook-wall_of_lead.def:
Place a Wall with dimensions 1×6" anywhere on the target.

Remove the Terrain Feature when the spell ends.

rulebook-molten_copper.title: Molten Copper
rulebook-molten_copper.def: The target suffers D3+1 hits with AP 4, Flaming Attacks, Magical Attacks,Zeal(towards Metal Armour). These hits always wound on 4+.

rulebook-word_of_iron.title: Word of Iron
rulebook-word_of_iron.def: The target gains +2 Arm and  Metal Armour.

rulebook-quicksilver_lash.title: Quicksilver Lash
rulebook-quicksilver_lash.def: The target suffers 2D3+1 hits with AP 4, Flaming Attacks, Magical Attacks,Zeal(towards Metal Armour). These hits always wound on 4+.

rulebook-duality.title: Duality
rulebook-duality.def:
All Cosmology spells are divided into two versions, representing opposing aspects:
Cosmos



and Chaos


.

When casting a Cosmology spell, always declare which version of the spell you are using, and substitute the square brackets ([𝛼]) with the content listed in the table at the bottom of each Spell Card corresponding to the chosen version (Cosmos or Chaos).

rulebook-altered_sight.title: Altered Sight
rulebook-altered_sight.def:
The target’s Offensive Skill is modified by [𝛼]. No model can be affected by more than one instance of each version of this spell simultaneously.

[𝛼]: +2
[𝛽]: -2

rulebook-truth_of_time.title: Truth of Time
rulebook-truth_of_time.def:
The target’s Charge Speed and Mobility are set to [𝛼].


[𝛼]: 8"
[𝛽]: 4"

rulebook-weal_and_woe.title: Weal and Woe
rulebook-weal_and_woe.def:
The target’s Melee Attacks to-wound rolls are modified by [𝛼] and gain Magical Attacks.

[𝛼]: +1
[𝛽]: -1

rulebook-ice_and_fire.title: Ice and Fire
rulebook-ice_and_fire.def:
The target suffers 2D6 hits with Str 4, AP 0, and Magical Attacks. Successful [𝛼] against wounds caused by this spell must be rerolled.


[𝛼]: Special Saves
[𝛽]: Armour Saves

rulebook-cosmic_scales.title: Cosmic Scales
rulebook-cosmic_scales.def:
The target must reroll to-hit and Armour Save rolls of [𝛼].

[𝛼]: 1
[𝛽]: 6

rulebook-thunder_and_lightning.title: Thunder and Lightning
rulebook-thunder_and_lightning.def:
=1pt
All hits are resolved with Str 6, AP 2, Lightning Attacks, Magical Attacks. The target suffers 3 hits. Before removing casualties, apply [𝛼]

[𝛼]: The target suffers 1 additional hit
[𝛽]: Select a new Unengaged enemy unit within 6" of the target: it suffers 2 hits. Before removing casualties, select a 3rd Unengaged enemy unit within 6" of the 2nd unit: it suffers 1 hit.

rulebook-foresight.title: Foresight
rulebook-foresight.def:
The target gains +2 Def and +2 Off.

No model can be affected by more than one instance of this spell simultaneously.

rulebook-chance_of_redemption.title: Chance of Redemption
rulebook-chance_of_redemption.def:
The target gains Divine Attacks.

In addition, it may immediately perform a 5" Magical Move.

rulebook-the_stars_align.title: The Stars Align
rulebook-the_stars_align.def: The target’s Melee Attacks must reroll failed to-hit rolls.

rulebook-fates_judgement.title: Fate’s Judgement
rulebook-fates_judgement.def: The target suffers 2D3+1 hits with AP 1 and Magical Attacks. These hits are set to wound on 6+, and gain +1 to wound for each friendly Player Turn before the current one (e.g. in your fourth Magic Phase, they wound on 3+).

rulebook-augury_of_despair.title: Augury of Despair
rulebook-augury_of_despair.def: The target suffers -1 Off and -1 Agi, both to a minimum of 1.

rulebook-inescapable_doom.title: Inescapable Doom
rulebook-inescapable_doom.def:
Immediately when the spell is cast and at the start of each of the Caster’s subsequent Magic Phases, the target suffers 1 hit that wounds automatically, with AP 10 and Magical Attacks.

No model can be affected by more than one instance of this spell simultaneously.

rulebook-fountain_of_youth.title: Fountain of Youth
rulebook-fountain_of_youth.def:
Choose one of the following effects for the target:


  • The Rank-and-File part of the target Raises 1 HP.

  • One model in the target Recovers 1 HP.

No Health Pool can Raise or Recover more than 1 HP per Magic Phase from this spell.

rulebook-entwining_roots.title: Entwining Roots
rulebook-entwining_roots.def: The target suffers -2" Cha and -2" Mob, both to a minimum of 2", as well as -2 Agi, to a minimum of 1.

rulebook-veil_of_mist.title: Veil of Mist
rulebook-veil_of_mist.def: All units within 12" of the target when Casting or Shooting suffer a -1 modifier to their Casting Rolls and a -1 to hit with Shooting Attacks.

rulebook-gravel_storm.title: Gravel Storm
rulebook-gravel_storm.def: The target suffers 2D3+1 hits with Str 3, AP 1, and Magical Attacks. If the target contains a Rank-and-File model with Light Troops, these hits are instead resolved with Str 4, AP 2, and Magical Attacks.

rulebook-stone_skin.title: Stone Skin
rulebook-stone_skin.def: The target gains +1 Res. In addition, Melee Attacks allocated against it never wound on better than 4+.

rulebook-quicksand.title: Quicksand
rulebook-quicksand.def: The target suffers -1 to-hit with its Melee Attacks. The first time in each Player Turn that it performs a Move (see the Definitions and Terminology chapter), each of its Health Pools must take a Dangerous Terrain(6+) Test.

rulebook-whispers_of_the_veil.title: Whispers of the Veil
rulebook-whispers_of_the_veil.def:
The target suffers -1 Res.



No model can be affected by more than one instance of this spell simultaneously.

rulebook-danse_macabre.title: Danse Macabre
rulebook-danse_macabre.def: The target gains Dying Blow, Ghost Step. In addition, it may immediately perform a 5" Magical Move.

rulebook-touch_of_the_reaper.title: Touch of the Reaper
rulebook-touch_of_the_reaper.def: The target suffers D3+1 hits with Str 9, AP 10, Magical Attacks, Psychic Attacks.

rulebook-spectral_blades.title: Spectral Blades
rulebook-spectral_blades.def: Standard Melee Attacks from Rank-and-File models in the target always have at least Str 4 and AP 4, and gain Magical Attacks.

rulebook-soul_blight.title: Soul Blight
rulebook-soul_blight.def: The target suffer 2D3+1 hits with Str 9, AP 10, Magical Attacks, Psychic Attacks.

rulebook-the_sacrifice.title: The Sacrifice
rulebook-the_sacrifice.def: Before casting certain spells (marked on the spell itself), you may choose a friendly unit within 12" of the Caster to immediately suffer from The Devouring Dark. No model or unit can be targeted by more than one instance during the same Magic Phase. If The Sacrifice was performed, the Range of the spell is increased by +6".

rulebook-the_devouring_dark.title: The Devouring Dark
rulebook-the_devouring_dark.def: The target suffers a hit with Area Attack(2×2), Str 5, AP 2, and Magical Attacks.

rulebook-hand_of_glory.title: Hand of Glory
rulebook-hand_of_glory.def:
The target gains Aegis(6+) and Aegis(+1, max. 3+).



The Sacrifice may be performed for this spell.

rulebook-blood_curse.title: Blood Curse
rulebook-blood_curse.def:
The target suffers -1 Str and -1 AP.



The Sacrifice may be performed for this spell.

rulebook-pentagram_of_pain.title: Pentagram of Pain
rulebook-pentagram_of_pain.def:
The target suffers 3 hits with Str 5, AP 2, and Magical Attacks.

If this spell causes at least one HP loss, the Caster of the spell Recovers 1 HP.



The Sacrifice may be performed for this spell.

rulebook-umbral_majesty.title: Umbral Majesty
rulebook-umbral_majesty.def:
Choose a single model part in the target unit when casting the spell: that model part gains Grind Attack(5, Str 5, AP 2, Unmodifiable).

The Sacrifice may be performed for this spell.

rulebook-the_grave_calls.title: The Grave Calls
rulebook-the_grave_calls.def:
The target suffers 8 hits with Str 5, AP 2, and Magical Attacks.

The Sacrifice may be performed for this spell.

rulebook-fireball.title: Fireball
rulebook-fireball.def:
The target suffers 2D3+1
hits with Str 4, AP 0, Flaming Attacks, Magical Attacks.

rulebook-flaming_swords.title: Flaming Swords
rulebook-flaming_swords.def: The target gains +1 to wound, Magical Attacks (Melee & Shooting), Flaming Attacks (Melee & Shooting).

rulebook-dragons_roar.title: Dragon’s Roar
rulebook-dragons_roar.def: Choose a single model part in the target unit when casting the spell. This model part gains Breath Attack(Str 4, AP 0, Flaming Attacks,Magical Attacks) and Grind Attack(2D6, Str 4, AP 0, Flaming Attacks, Magical Attacks, Unmodifiable).

rulebook-pyroclastic_flow.title: Pyroclastic Flow
rulebook-pyroclastic_flow.def:
The target suffers 5D3
hits with Str 4, AP 0, Flaming Attacks, Magical Attacks.

rulebook-pillars_of_fire.title: Pillars of Fire
rulebook-pillars_of_fire.def: Standard Melee Attacks from Rank-and-File models in the target are always Str 4 and AP 0, and gain Flaming Attacks,Magical Attacks, Automatic Hits.

rulebook-cage_of_embers.title: Cage of Embers
rulebook-cage_of_embers.def:
Immediately when the spell is cast, the target suffers 2D3
hits with Str 4, AP 0, Flaming Attacks, Magical Attacks.
After the initial hits the target gains Weakness(Flaming Attacks).
In addition, whenever the target moves (see Definitions and Terminology chapter), it suffers 2D3
hits with Str 4, AP 0, Flaming Attacks, Magical Attacks.

rulebook-predators_instinct.title: Predator’s Instinct
rulebook-predators_instinct.def:
The target gains +2" Cha and Resistance(Ranged Attacks).



No model can be affected by more than one instance of this spell simultaneously.

rulebook-savage_fury.title: Savage Fury
rulebook-savage_fury.def: The target gains Fury,Fearless,Unruly,Frenzy. In addition, the target can never be wounded on better than 3+.

rulebook-awaken_the_beast.title: Awaken the Beast
rulebook-awaken_the_beast.def: The target gains +1 Str and +1 AP.

rulebook-swarm_of_insects.title: Swarm of Insects
rulebook-swarm_of_insects.def:
Immediately when the spell is cast, the target suffers 5D6 hits with AP 0 and Magical Attacks, and that always wound on 6+.

In addition, it suffers -1 to hit with Shooting Attacks.

rulebook-wild_spikes.title: Wild Spikes
rulebook-wild_spikes.def: Choose a single model part in the target unit when casting the spell. This model part gains Grind Attack(4, Str 6, AP 3, Unmodifiable)

rulebook-totemic_summon.title: Totemic Summon
rulebook-totemic_summon.def: Summon a Totemic Beast (see profile below).

rulebook-divine_intervention.title: Divine Intervention
rulebook-divine_intervention.def:
When resolving the effects of a Thaumaturgy spell, roll either 1D6 or 2D6:

  • If every dice rolls a ‘5’ or ‘6’: apply the Blessing effects (marked with a
✠).

  • If every dice rolls a ‘1’: apply the Admonition effects (marked with a
×).

rulebook-smite_the_unbeliever.title: Smite the Unbeliever
rulebook-smite_the_unbeliever.def:
The target suffers D6 hits with Str 5, AP 2, and Magical Attacks.

✠: these hits are instead resolved with Str 7, AP 2, and Magical Attacks

×: these hits are instead resolved with Str 3, AP 2, and Magical Attacks

rulebook-light_of_faith.title: Light of Faith
rulebook-light_of_faith.def:
The target counts as having one fewer Proper Ranks when Engaged.

✠: two fewer Proper Ranks instead

×: the spell has no effect

rulebook-weight_of_judgement.title: Weight of Judgement
rulebook-weight_of_judgement.def:
The target suffers -2 Agi, to a minimum of 1.

✠: -3 Agi instead

×: -1 Agi instead

rulebook-holy_affliction.title: Holy Affliction
rulebook-holy_affliction.def:
The target suffers -1 to wound.

✠: in addition, the target suffers -1 AP

×: in addition, the target gains +1 AP

rulebook-wrath_of_god.title: Wrath of God
rulebook-wrath_of_god.def:
Place a marker on the target point. Do not roll for Divine Intervention when resolving the effects of this spell. You must roll for Divine Intervention at the start of each subsequent Magic Phase:

✠: each unit within 2D6" of the centre of the marker suffers 2D6 hits with Str 5, AP 2, and Magical Attacks. Then remove the marker.

×: your opponent may move the marker up to 3" in any direction.

rulebook-rain_of_fire.title: Rain of Fire
rulebook-rain_of_fire.def:
The target suffers D3+1 hits. All other units within 3" of the target suffer 1 hit.
All hits are resolved with Str 9, AP 4, Magical Attacks,Flaming Attacks,.

✠: increase the number of hits each unit suffers by 1.

×: decrease the number of hits each unit suffers by 1.

rulebook-evil_eye.title: Evil Eye
rulebook-evil_eye.def:
The target suffers -1 Cha and -1 Mob (both to a minimum of 3), and -1 Agi (to a minimum of 1).



No model can be affected by more than one instance of this spell simultaneously.

rulebook-soured_luck.title: Soured Luck
rulebook-soured_luck.def: Melee Attacks against the target are set to hit on at least 3+ .

rulebook-illusory_paths.title: Illusory Paths
rulebook-illusory_paths.def:
Choose which effect to apply when casting the spell:


  • The target gains Random Movement(2D6").

  • The target gains Random Movement(3D6").

rulebook-clouded_sight.title: Clouded Sight
rulebook-clouded_sight.def: The target cannot draw Line of Sight to a target more than 12" away from it.

rulebook-mists_of_invisibility.title: Mists of Invisibility
rulebook-mists_of_invisibility.def:
Mark the point under the centre of the target, then remove the target from the Battlefield. At the start of your next friendly Movement Phase, place it back using Ambush (within 12″ of the marked point).


*Cannot target Shaken units

rulebook-afflict.title: Afflict
rulebook-afflict.def:
Units in contact with one or more enemy models with Afflict(X), suffer the effects given by X.

A unit can only be affected by one instance of Afflict(X) with an identical X value at a time.

If the brackets from two instances of Afflict are not identical (i.e., they have a different X), then they are considered different rules: apply the effects of both.

rulebook-ambush.title: Ambush
rulebook-ambush.def:
Any unit entirely with Ambush may choose to not be Deployed normally, but to be placed in Ambush by simply not being placed on the Battlefield during Deployment. A unit placed in Ambush will arrive on the Battlefield later during the game.

From your Player Turn 2 and onwards, roll a D6 for each unit placed in Ambush at the start of the Movement Phase: every unit that rolls a 3+ will arrive on the Battlefield if possible.

During your Player Turn 5 and 6, this roll is always considered to have rolled a 3+.

When a unit arrives on the Battlefield, choose a point as specified by X.
If no suitable point is available where the unit can be placed on the Battlefield, the unit cannot arrive on the Battlefield this turn.

Deploy each unit arriving on the Battlefield with at least three of its four corners within 6" from the chosen point in any valid formation following the Unit Spacing rule.

There must be no other units or Impassable Terrain directly located between any point on the Unit Boundary and the chosen point. See the figure below for examples.

Ambushing units count as having performed an Advance Move when they arrive on the Battlefield, and cannot perform any Move in the same Phase.

If an Ambushing unit does not arrive on the Battlefield by the end of the game, it is removed as a casualty.

An Attachable Model placed in Ambush can be Deployed joined to a unit placed in Ambush with the same X value, following the usual restrictions. It may choose a unit to be joined to during each of your Player Turns, before rolling to see if your Ambushing units arrive on the Battlefield.

Make a single dice roll for the Combined Unit.

Note: Attached has no effect on this; the choice of a unit to be Deployed in Ambush in may change each turn.

A unit arriving on the Battlefield in Game Turn 6 loses Scoring.

Deploying Ambushing units.In these examples, the unit has Ambush(Battlefield Edge). The unit with the yellow check mark is placed in a valid position, while the two units with red crosses are not: the left one because there is an Impassable Terrain Feature between the Unit Boundary and the chosen point, and the right one because parts of the unit are more than 6" away from the chosen point.

rulebook-attached.title: Attached
rulebook-attached.def: This model must be Deployed inside a unit with at least one Rank-and-File model, and cannot voluntarily leave its unit.

rulebook-bodyguard.title: Bodyguard
rulebook-bodyguard.def:
While a Character that fulfil at least one of the criteria defined in X, is joined to a unit containing Bodyguard that Character gains Stubborn.


Moreover, if the unit it is joined to has at least one Proper Rank, the unit is considered to be Steadfast both Steady and Solid for the purposes of Break Tests.

Note: units with Unstable do not take Break Tests.

rulebook-captain.title: Captain
rulebook-captain.def:
A unit containing Captain gains the following additional rules:


  • If the unit has a Standard Bearer, it is considered to be within range of its Battle Standard Bearer’s* Rally Around the Flag rule.

  • If the unit has a Musician, it is considered to be within range of its General’s* Commanding Presence rule.

A unit can only contain a single Attachable Model with Captain.

*Provided such a model is on the Battlefield at all.

rulebook-channel.title: Channel
rulebook-channel.def:
A model with Channel may add X Magic Dice during the Siphon the Veil step of its Magic Phase.

Note: Shaken models may not use this rule.

rulebook-commanding_presence.title: Commanding Presence
rulebook-commanding_presence.def:
Friendly models in units within 12″ of a non-Shaken model with Commanding Presence set their Discipline to that model’s Discipline: apply any modifiers to the Discipline of the model with Commanding Presence first, then set any affected models’ Discipline to that modified value (note: ignore this rule if the model’s original value is higher).

If any rules, properties, unit names, etc. are mentioned in brackets (X), it means that only units possessing these qualities can benefit from the model’s Commanding Presence.

rulebook-disciplined.title: Disciplined
rulebook-disciplined.def: Command Tests taken by a unit containing Disciplined gain Minimized.

rulebook-dying_blow.title: Dying Blow
rulebook-dying_blow.def: When a model with Dying Blow is about to be removed as a casualty during any Agility Step of a Round of Combat it is fighting, remove it instead at the end of Agility Step 0.

rulebook-emplacement.title: Emplacement
rulebook-emplacement.def:
Units entirely with Emplacement cannot Declare Charges, perform March Moves or Pursue Moves (including as part of a Random Movement), or choose the Flee! Charge Reaction. If a unit entirely with Emplacement is about to perform a Flee Move, it is instead removed as a casualty.

The model cannot shoot in the same Player Turn that it has performed a Move Manoeuvre.

Units entirely with Emplacement can draw Line of Sight in any direction from any points on their base (i.e. they are not limited by their Front Facing or Front Arc).

When determining facing it is shooting towards, measure from the centre of model with Emplacement´s base, instead of its Front Facing.

rulebook-engineer.title: Engineer
rulebook-engineer.def:
Once during each Shooting Phase, a non-Shaken and Unengaged model with Engineer can select a friendly model with X in a unit within 6": the chosen model gains +1 to hit with Shooting Attacks, to a maximum of 3+.

No model can be affected by more than one instance of this effect simultaneously.

The use of this rule must be declared before shooting with the chosen model.

rulebook-exclusive.title: Exclusive
rulebook-exclusive.def:
This rule limits which units an Attachable Model is allowed to join.


  • Attachable Models with Exclusive(X) can only join units containing X.

  • Non-Attachable Models with Exclusive(X) can only be joined by Attachable Models with X.

  • If a unit has multiple instances of Exclusive, all criteria must be fulfilled together.

The specific criteria for X can be unit names, Model Rules, Properties, upgrades, etc.

If a model has both Exclusive and Attached, apply all requirements from both rules (remember that a model that cannot be Deployed is considered a casualty).

rulebook-fearless.title: Fearless
rulebook-fearless.def:
A unit containing Fearless automatically passes Panic Tests, cannot choose Flee! as a Charge Reaction (unless it is already Shaken, or the entire unit has Feigned Flight).

In addition it ignores the effects of Horror.

rulebook-feigned_flight.title: Feigned Flight
rulebook-feigned_flight.def:
A unit entirely with Feigned Flight in contact with an enemy unit may choose to voluntarily become "Broken" at the start of step 4.C of a Round of Combat (Take Break Tests), if so, the unit is considered to have failed a Break Test and is ignored for the rest of step 4.C.

If the unit was on the winning side of the Round of Combat, the enemy cannot Pursue.

Note: This means units with Supernal or Unstable suffer no Health Point loss if they voluntarily become 'Broken'.

In addition, A unit entirely with Feigned Flight automatically passes any Rally Test it takes after voluntarily becoming Shaken

models with Fearless and Feigned Flight ignore Fearless for the purposes of choosing 'Flee!' as a Charge reaction. I.e. if every model with Fearless in a (combined) unit has Feigned Flight, the unit can 'Flee!'.

rulebook-fly.title: Fly
rulebook-fly.def:
Units entirely with Fly ignore Terrain Features, Open Terrain and other units during Move Manoeuvres and Charge Moves.

The unit must follow the Unit Spacing rule at the end of any of its moves, and Terrain Features and Open Terrain from which the model starts or ends its move still affect it.

The charged unit is not ignored during a Charge Move, and there must be room for the unit’s Front Facing to be placed in contact with the charged unit before the initial Align Move.

rulebook-frenzy.title: Frenzy
rulebook-frenzy.def: Units containing Frenzy must always choose to Pursue (including Overrun) when able to.

rulebook-general.title: General
rulebook-general.def:
A model with this rule is always the General. Note: this means than only one model with General can be included in an Army List.

General

An army may include a General.

This upgrade is Legendary.

The General gains Commanding Presence (see Model Rules).

rulebook-ghost_step.title: Ghost Step
rulebook-ghost_step.def:
A unit entirely with Ghost Step ignores Terrain Features and Open Terrain when moving.

The unit must follow the Unit Spacing rule at the end of its move.

A Health Pool with Ghost Step never fulfils the criteria for which models must take Dangerous Terrain Tests due to Terrain Features (but still needs to take Dangerous Terrain Tests from other sources than Terrain Features, such as when making a Flee Move through an enemy unit).

If the unit ends a move inside Impassable Terrain, backtrack the move to the unit’s last valid position, unless as part of a Flee Move, in which case the standard Flee Moves rules apply.

rulebook-hidden.title: Hidden
rulebook-hidden.def:
The model is not Deployed as normal.

Instead, at the start of any Player Turn, it may choose a friendly Rank-and-File model, which satisfy the following criteria:


  • The model with Hidden could normally have joined the unit.

  • The model with Hidden has an identical base size and Height as the Rank-and-File models in the unit.

  • The unit is not Shaken and is not a Summoned unit but it can be Engaged in Combat.

After choosing an eligible unit, follow these steps:


  • Remove a Rank-and-File model, with the same base size as the model with Hidden, from the front rank of the chosen unit as a casualty.

  • Deploy the model with Hidden where the removed model was positioned.

Note: Attachable models with Hidden can still be Deployed using the Hidden rules.

rulebook-horror.title: Horror
rulebook-horror.def:
Flee Moves from enemy units made in the following situations gain two instances of Minimised:


  • Flee! Charge Reactions declared when Charged by a unit containing Horror (Flee! Charge Reactions declared when later Charged by other units are unaffected).

  • Breaking from Combat while in contact with one or more units containing Horror.



Remember that units containing Fearless are unaffected by this rule.

rulebook-insignificant.title: Insignificant
rulebook-insignificant.def: Units entirely with Insignificant do not cause Panic Tests on units not containing Insignificant when making Flee Moves through them.

rulebook-light_troops.title: Light Troops
rulebook-light_troops.def:
A unit entirely with Light Troops can perform Reform Move Manoeuvres up to twice its Mobility (instead of the normal half Mobility).


  • If, while doing a Reform Move Manoeuvre, its centre moves further than its Mobility, the move is considered a March Move for the purpose of rules triggered due to Marching (e.g. Dangerous Terrain Test and, if Undead, being restricted from performing a March Move, etc.).

For the purpose of shooting, this is still a Reform Move. I.e. the unit can shoot if moving further than its Mobility

Note: this rule has no effect on other Move Manoeuvres, including March Moves

  • If the Reform Move is started within 3" of a non-Shaken enemy unit containing a Musician, the Reform Move is instead limited to its Mobility.
Note that the unit with Light Troops can still perform a regular March Move.

A unit containing Light Troops is always considered to have zero Proper Ranks; ignore Attachable Models with Light Troops joined to a unit for this purpose, unless the unit consists of only Attachable Models.

rulebook-meetingofminds.title: Meeting of Minds
rulebook-meetingofminds.def: The model gains Scent of Blood and treats all friendly models with Beast as Insignificant.

rulebook-mindless.title: Mindless
rulebook-mindless.def: A unit entirely with this rule automatically passes its Command Tests for Combat Reform, and automatically fails its Command Tests for Redirecting Charges.

rulebook-protean_magic.title: Protean Magic
rulebook-protean_magic.def:
The model knows X different Learned Spells and is a Wizard. It does not choose a Path of Magic, instead it can select the Apprentice Spell (#1) from all Magic Paths available to it.

It may Swap Spells during Pre-game Selections. See the Battle Preparation chapter for details.

rulebook-rally_around_the_flag.title: Rally Around the Flag
rulebook-rally_around_the_flag.def: Friendly models in units within 12" of a friendly non-Shaken model with Rally Around the Flag must reroll failed Courage Tests.

rulebook-random_movement.title: Random Movement
rulebook-random_movement.def:
Units entirely with Random Movement do not follow normal rules for Charging, Move Manoeuvres, Pursue Moves or Flee Moves.

Instead, apply the following:


  • During the Charge Phase, the model cannot Declare any Charges.

  • At any time the model would perform a Move Manoeuvre, the unit performs a Pursue Move instead (see the Melee Phase chapter), with the following exceptions:

  • It must move in the Movement Phase if allowed to do so, and it must do so before any units without Random Movement have performed their Move Manoeuvres.

  • It moves the distance stated in brackets (X).

  • It can choose which direction it will move in (the owning player must choose which direction before rolling the Pursuit Distance).

  • It does not take Dangerous Terrain Tests, unless Charging.

  • It treats the Table Edge as Impassable Terrain.

  • That move counts as an Advance Move for the purpose of Moving and Shooting.



  • The model’s Pursue and Flee Moves use the distance stated in brackets (X), instead of the normal distance.

  •

Whenever a rule requires the Mobility or Charge Speed of the model, use the potential maximum value of X (eg. if X is 2D6", then consider the Mobility and Charge Speed to be equal to 12").

Note that this means a model with Random Movement cannot perform any Magical Move nor use Vanguard. )

It also means that effects that modify its Pursue Distance, such as Maximized and Minimized, also affect its moves.

rulebook-resolute.title: Resolute
rulebook-resolute.def:
A unit containing Resolute and that has at least one Proper Rank is considered to have X additional Proper Ranks when Engaged in Combat. Note: this is applied before applying the effects of Surrounded.

If the value in brackets (X) includes a +, it can be added to another instance of Resolute in the unit.

rulebook-scout.title: Scout
rulebook-scout.def:
Units entirely with Scout are not required to be Deployed inside their Deployment Zone: instead, they can be Deployed anywhere on the Battlefield, at least 12" away from the opponent’s Deployment Zone.

A unit that starts the game outside its own Deployment Zone cannot declare a Charge in the first Player Turn of the first Game Turn.

rulebook-skirmisher.title: Skirmisher
rulebook-skirmisher.def:
Units containing Skirmisher adopt a unique formation, called a Skirmish Formation. Instead of being in contact with each other, these models are placed 12.5mm apart from each other (roughly half an inch, see the figure below).

These gaps between the models are considered part of the unit for Cover and Line of Sight purposes, and have the same Height as the unit.
Other than this gap between models, units with Skirmisher follow the normal rules for forming units and therefore have a Front, two Flanks, and a Rear Facing, can perform Supporting Attacks, and so on.

Units in Skirmish Formation can only be joined by Attachable Models that have the same Height as the unit.

Unless an Attachable Model has the exact same base size as all Rank-and-File models in the unit, it is considered Mismatched for the purpose of placement within the unit.

The unit ceases to be in Skirmish Formation when all models with Skirmisher have been removed. When this happens, contract their Skirmish Formation into a normal formation when returning the unit into a valid formation, without moving the centre of the first rank. If Engaged in Combat, nudge any unit as normal to maintain contact.

See figure figure/skirmisher for an illustration of this rule.

Skirmish formation.An example of a unit in Skirmish Formation with a joined Mismatching Character. All models are 12.5 mm away from each other.\
The same unit Engaged in Combat. Only darkened models may attack. Models with a dashed frame can attack a Character (either C1 or C2). Models with a lighter shade cannot attack at all.

rulebook-solitary.title: Solitary
rulebook-solitary.def: Units containing Solitary can never join other units, and can never be joined by other models.

rulebook-stand_behind.title: Stand Behind
rulebook-stand_behind.def:
Attachable Models with Stand Behind are not required to have their Front Facing as far forward as possible within their unit this generally means that the model can be positioned anywhere within its unit.

This rule cannot be used while the model has a Mismatching base to its unit.

rulebook-strider.title: Strider
rulebook-strider.def:
If Strider is associated with a specific type of Terrain, which would be indicated in brackets (X). In such cases, Strider only affects the unit’s interaction with this Terrain Feature.

Models with Strider may ignore rules associated with Terrain Features, with the following exceptions:


  • They cannot ignore any rule affecting Line of Sight or Cover.

  • They cannot ignore any rule associated with Weakness.

  • They cannot ignore the Impassable rule of Impassable Terrain.

A Health Pool with Strider never fulfils the criteria for which models must take Dangerous Terrain Tests due to the associated Terrain Feature (but still needs to take Dangerous Terrain Tests from other sources, such as Terrain Features not associated with its Strider rule, or when making a Flee Move through an enemy unit).

In addition, if the unit contains a Rank-and-File model with Strider, it ignores the Disruptive rule of any Terrain Feature associated to its Strider rule.

rulebook-stubborn.title: Stubborn
rulebook-stubborn.def:
When a unit containing Stubborn loses a Round of Combat, halve the penalty to its Discipline from the Combat Score difference, rounding fractions up (i.e. towards a larger modifier).

If the unit is also Steady, the modifier is first set to no smaller than -2 (following the Steady rules), and then halved, rounding up, to -1.

If the unit is Unstable, the Health Point losses due to Unstable are halved, rounding fractions up (i.e. towards more Health Point losses).

rulebook-supernal.title: Supernal
rulebook-supernal.def:
When a unit entirely with Supernal fails a Break Test, instead of being Broken and subsequently Shaken, it suffers a number of Health Point losses equal to the amount by which the combat was lost (with no saves of any kind allowed).

These Health Point losses are first allocated towards Rank-and-File models, and once enough Health Points losses are suffered to remove all Rank-and-File models, any remaining Health Point losses are allocated by the owner towards Attachable Models, as evenly as possible.

Attachable Models with Supernal can only join units containing Supernal, and units containing Supernal can only be joined by Attachable Models with Supernal.

rulebook-swiftstride.title: Swiftstride
rulebook-swiftstride.def: Rolls for Charge Range, Flee Distance and Pursue Distance by units entirely with Swiftstride gain Maximised.

rulebook-terror.title: Terror
rulebook-terror.def:
When a unit containing Terror declares a Charge in the Charge Phase, the target must take a Panic Test. If the test is failed, the unit must choose Flee! as its Charge Reaction if allowed to do so (e.g. not already Engaged in Combat, etc.).

Note that this Flee Move is not voluntary: friendly units may therefore be required to take a Panic Test when moving through them.

Units containing Terror are themselves immune to the effects of Terror.

rulebook-undead.title: Undead
rulebook-undead.def:
Units containing Undead can perform March Moves only if they benefit from a friendly model’s Commanding Presence. For this purpose, any Reform Move exceeding a unit’s Mobility count as a March Move.

Moreover, models with Undead have an additional characteristic called Resurrect (Rsr) on their statline, which can interact with some other game effects.

rulebook-unruly.title: Unruly
rulebook-unruly.def: Command Tests taken by a unit containing this rule gain Maximised.

rulebook-unstable.title: Unstable
rulebook-unstable.def:
Whenever a unit entirely with Unstable would take a Break Test, it suffers instead a number of Health Point losses equal to the amount by which the Combat was lost (with no saves of any kind allowed).

These Health Point losses are first allocated towards Rank-and-File models, and once enough Health Points losses are suffered to remove all Rank-and-File models, any remaining Health Point losses are allocated by the owner towards Attachable Models, as evenly as possible.

Those Health Point losses can be reduced in the following ways:


  • If the unit contains Stubborn, the Health Point losses are halved, rounding fractions up.

  • If the unit is affected by Rally Around the Flag, the Health Point losses are reduced by 1.

  • If the unit is Steady while affected by Rally Around the Flag, the Health Point losses are reduced by an additional 1.

  • If the unit is Solid while affected by Rally Around the Flag, the Health Point losses are reduced by an additional 1.

I.e. a unit that is affected by Rally Around the Flag while also being both Steady and solid reduces its Health Point losses by a total of 3.

Attachable Models with Unstable can only join units containing Unstable, and units containing Unstable can only be joined by Attachable Models with Unstable.

rulebook-vanguard.title: Vanguard
rulebook-vanguard.def:
After Deployment, units entirely with Vanguard may perform a pre-game Move Manoeuvre (Reform, Advance, or March Move), called a Vanguard Move, with the following exceptions:


  • If a value X is given, the unit’s Mobility is always X" during the Vanguard Move.

  • No model can move further than 12" during the Vanguard Move, regardless of its Mobility.

  • The unit cannot end the Vanguard Move within 6" of an enemy unit.

  • Attachable Models cannot leave a unit as part of the Vanguard Move.

If both players have units entirely with Vanguard, they alternate moving their units one by one, starting with the unit that the Defender chose for Defender’s Advantage.

A unit that starts the game outside its own Deployment Zone cannot declare a Charge in the first Player Turn of the first Game Turn.

rulebook-war_platform.title: War Platform
rulebook-war_platform.def:
The model follows the rules for Attachable Models, with the following exceptions:


  • It can never perform Make Way moves (not even if it is also a Character).

  • For the purpose of allocating Ranged Attacks onto a unit with a War Platform joined to it, the model with War Platform is considered to be of the same Height as the Rank-and-File models in its unit (if there are no Rank-and-File models in the unit, ignore this rule).

  • Any given unit can never contain more than one single model with War Platform at a time.

When the model is joined to a unit, its Mobility and Charge Speed is set to that of its unit, with the following exceptions:


  • If there are no Rank-and-File models from the unit in contact with the War Platform’s flank Facings (right and left side), the model must use its own Mobility and Charge Speed instead. Meaning that, if slower than the unit, the unit’s Mobility and Charge Speed are set to those of the War Platform.

  • The War Platform cannot use the unit’s Mobility and Charge Speed values when leaving the unit (including Charging out of it). Instead, it uses its own Mobility and Charge Speed.

rulebook-wizard_apprentice.title: Wizard Apprentice
rulebook-wizard_apprentice.def:
The model becomes a Wizard, knows 1 Learned Spell, which is the Apprentice Spell (#1) of the Path it has chosen.

It may Swap Spells during Pre-game Selections. See the Battle Preparation chapter for details.

rulebook-wizard_adept.title: Wizard Adept
rulebook-wizard_adept.def:
The model becomes a Wizard, gains Channel(1), and knows 3 different Learned Spells, chosen from the Apprentice Spell and the Adept Spells (#1 – #4) of the Magic Path it has chosen.

It may Swap Spells during Pre-game Selections. See the Battle Preparation chapter for details.

rulebook-wizard_master.title: Wizard Master
rulebook-wizard_master.def:
The model becomes a Wizard, gains Channel(2) and knows 5 different Learned Spells, chosen from the Apprentice Spell, the Adept, and Master Spells (#1 – #6) of the Magic Path it has chosen.

It may Swap Spells during Pre-game Selections. See the Battle Preparation chapter for details.

rulebook-wizard_conclave.title: Wizard Conclave
rulebook-wizard_conclave.def:
The unit knows X different Learned Spells, chosen from the list of available spells in its unit entry, is a Wizard and, if X is 2 or more, it also gains Channel(1).

The unit may only do a Hereditary Swap if it could have picked the Hereditary Spell during Spell Selection (as part of Pre-game Planning), however it is still eligible for a Universal Swap. See Battle Preparation chapter for details.

Even though the spells are known to the whole unit, only one model is a Caster: every time you cast the spell, just before choosing the targets, select one Rank-and-File model as the Caster for this spell.

If a Wizard Conclave suffers a Miscast, treat the entire unit as the Caster.

For the purpose of Primary and Secondary Objectives treat the entire unit as a Caster.

rulebook-aegis.title: Aegis
rulebook-aegis.def:
Aegis is a Special Save, with a value indicated in brackets (X).

If X is given as a modifier and with a maximum value (e.g. +2), the model gains this as a modifier to all its Aegis Special Save rolls, which can never be increased to rolls better than 3+. If the model does not have Aegis, it instead gains Aegis(7 X+).
For example, a model without Aegis that gains Aegis(+2) will gain Aegis(5+).

Note that Aegis Saves cannot be taken against attacks with Divine Attacks.

rulebook-distracting.title: Distracting
rulebook-distracting.def:
Melee Attacks allocated against a Health Pool with Distracting suffer -1 to hit.

Ignore Distracting if the final to hit chance would be worse than 5+.

rulebook-regeneration.title: Regeneration
rulebook-regeneration.def:
Regeneration is a Special Save, with a value indicated in brackets (X).

If X is given as a modifier and with a maximum value (e.g. +2), the model gains this as a modifier to all its Regeneration Special Save rolls, which can never be increased to rolls better than 3+. If the model does not have Regeneration, it instead gains Regeneration(7 X+).
For example, a model without Regeneration that gains Regeneration(+2) will gain Regeneration(5+).

Note that Regeneration Saves cannot be taken against attacks with Flaming Attacks, nor against attacks with Lethal Strike that roll a ‘6’ to wound.

rulebook-hard_target.title: Hard Target
rulebook-hard_target.def: Shooting Attacks allocated against a Health Pool with Hard Target suffer -X to hit.

rulebook-immune.title: Immune
rulebook-immune.def: Attacks with the Attack Attributes or Properties stated in brackets (X) allocated against a model with Immune(X) lose those Attack Attributes or Properties.

rulebook-parry.title: Parry
rulebook-parry.def:
Against Melee Attacks made by an attacker Engaged in the models Front Facing, the Defensive Skill of a model with Parry is always at least equal to the Offensive Skill of the attacker.

Remember that since Parry provides a modifier to a Defensive Characteristic, its effects do not apply to a Character on a mount that has its own Defensive Skill.

rulebook-resistance.title: Resistance
rulebook-resistance.def:
Attacks allocated against the model’s Health Pool must reroll successful to-wound rolls.

If Resistance is associated with an Attack Attribute, Property or Rule in brackets (X), then it only applies against attacks with that Attack Attribute or made by a model with that Property or Rule.

rulebook-weakness.title: Weakness
rulebook-weakness.def:
Attacks allocated against the model’s Health Pool must reroll failed to-wound rolls.

If Weakness is associated with an Attack Attribute, Property or Rule, which would be indicated in brackets (X), it only applies against attacks with the indicated Attack Attribute or made by a model with the indicated Property or Rule.

rulebook-weapons.title: Weapons
rulebook-weapons.def:
Weapons is a subcategory of Model Rules.
Just as with Attack Attributes, a Weapon can only be used by the specific model part with the rule.

There are two types of weapons:


  • Melee Weapon: a model part can only use a single Melee Weapon at a time, and only when Engaged in Combat.

If a model part is equipped with multiple Melee Weapons, the weapon it uses is determined in the First Round of Combat, with the following priority order:


  • An Enchanted Weapon

  • Any weapon that is neither a Hand Weapon, nor an Innate Weapon

  • A Hand Weapon

  • An Innate Weapon


This choice is then kept until the model is no longer Engaged in Combat.
The effects of Melee Weapons only apply to the model part’s Standard Melee Attacks.



  • If the Melee Weapon confers any modifier to Offensive Characteristics, as well as Attack Attributes, those effects are applied only to the model part’s Standard Melee Attacks.

  • If the Melee Weapon confers any modifier to Global or Defensive Characteristics (Charge Speed, Mobility, Courage, Defensive Skill, Hit Points, Resilience, and Armour), as well as Model Rules that are not Attack Attributes, those effects are applied to the whole model (or model part, see rules for Character Mounts for details when and how the Characteristics of mounts are affected) at all times, except while using a different Melee Weapon.

  • If the Melee Weapon confers any variable modifier (such as those based on a dice roll), the value of that modifier is determined at the start of the Agility Step in which the weapon is used.




  • Shooting Weapons: Shooting Weapons are used for making Shooting Attacks.

Each model part can only use one Shooting Weapon per phase.

A Shooting Weapon generally has an Aim value, shown in brackets after the name of the weapon. The rules for each Shooting Weapon define its maximum Range, the number of Shots fired per attack, its attacks’ Strength and Armour Penetration, as well as any potential Attack Attributes applied to them.

rulebook-melee_weapons.title: Melee Weapons
rulebook-melee_weapons.def:
1whiteblack!5
5pt

Name & Characteristics Modifiers & Model Rules
Innate Weapons \All model parts with Mount, Beast, Construct come equipped with Innate Weapons as their default equipment and cannot lose them. & -- & When Choosing Equipment and Abilities, a model part can only choose Innate Weapons if it has no other options.
Hand Weapon \All model parts without Innate Weapons come equipped with a Hand Weapon as their default equipment and cannot lose it. & -- &
When Choosing Equipment and Abilities, a model part can only choose a Hand Weapon if it has no other options, or is a Weapon Master.
Models with a Shield using a Hand Weapon gain Parry.
Great Weapon & +2 Str, +2 AP, always Agi & Two-Handed
Halberd & +1 Str, +1 AP & Two-Handed.
Lance \Only models with Mount, Centauroid can use a Lance. & Devastating Charge(+2 Str, +2 AP, +1 Agi) & --
Light Lance \Only models with ̉Mount, Centauroid can use a Light Lance. & Devastating Charge(+1 Str, +1 AP) & --
Paired Weapons & +1 Att, +1 Off & Two-Handed.

Attacks made with Paired Weapons ignore Parry.
Spear \Models with Mount, Centauroid cannot use a Spear. & \+1 Agi, +1 AP, and +1 additional AP towards Mount, Centauroid & Fight in Extra Rank

Melee Combat Weapons

rulebook-great_weapon.title: Great Weapon
rulebook-great_weapon.def:
+2 Str, +2 AP, always Agi*, Two-Handed

*Always strike at Agility Step 0, regardless of the wielder’s Agility.

rulebook-hand_weapon.title: Hand Weapon
rulebook-hand_weapon.def: All models come equipped with a Hand Weapon as their default equipment and cannot lose it. & -- & Models using a Hand Weapon alongside a Shield gain Parry. A model equipped with another Melee Weapon must use this, and cannot use its Hand Weapon.

rulebook-lance.title: Lance
rulebook-lance.def: Models on foot cannot use Lances. Devastating Charge(+2 Str, +2 AP, +1 Agi)

rulebook-light_lance.title: Light Lance
rulebook-light_lance.def: Models on foot cannot use Light Lances. Devastating Charge(+1 Str, +1 AP)

rulebook-paired_weapons.title: Paired Weapons
rulebook-paired_weapons.def: +1 Att, +1 Off, Two-Handed. Attacks made with Paired Weapons ignore Parry

rulebook-spear.title: Spear
rulebook-spear.def: +1 Agi, +1 AP, +1 additional AP against Mount or Centauroid Fight in Extra Rank

rulebook-bow.title: Bow
rulebook-bow.def: Range 24", Shots 1, Str 3, AP 0, Shoot in Extra Rank

rulebook-pistol.title: Pistol
rulebook-pistol.def: Range 12", Shots 1, Str 4, AP 2, Quick to Fire, Stand and Shoot

rulebook-throwing_weapons.title: Throwing Weapons
rulebook-throwing_weapons.def: Range 8", Shots 2, Str as user, AP as user, Accurate, Quick to Fire, Stand and Shoot

rulebook-stand_and_shoot.title: Stand and Shoot
rulebook-stand_and_shoot.def:
A model part with Stand and Shoot may perform an out of sequence Shooting Attack, when an enemy unit successfully performs a Charge Move that brings it in contact with the model part’s unit, if the following conditions are met:


  • The model part’s unit is not Engaged in Combat with any other units.
Note: this means that during a Combined Charge, only the first Charging Unit moved can be targeted, except if the Charging Unit is removed at the end of its move. As long as the Charging Unit is removed at the end of its move, there is no limit on the amount of times a unit can Stand and Shoot.


  • The enemy unit Charges the model part’s unit in its Front Facing.

  • The enemy unit started the Charge further away than its Charge Speed (using the lowest Charge Speed in the unit

  • The Charge was not done as part of a Pursue Move.

This is a Shooting Attack that does not require Line of Sight, can be done even if the enemy unit is not in the shooter’s Front Arc, and is always resolved against the target unit’s (i.e., the Charging unit’s) Front Facing.

rulebook-artillery.title: Artillery
rulebook-artillery.def:
An attack with Artillery ignores to-hit modifiers from Cover.

In addition, it gains +1 to-hit when shooting at units that are Solid, have Height 5, or both.

rulebook-accurate.title: Accurate
rulebook-accurate.def: An attack with Accurate does not suffer the -1 to-hit modifier for shooting at Long Range.

rulebook-area_attack.title: Area Attack
rulebook-area_attack.def:
Before making a Shooting Attack with Area Attack, determine the attack’s Target Facing using the same rules as for Cover.

  • If the attack hits in the Front or Rear: select up to Y different ranks of the target.

  • If the attack hits in the Flank: select up to Y different files of the target.

For each rank or file chosen this way, the unit takes X hits, up to a maximum equal to the number of models in that rank or file.

An Area Attack can not cause more hits than the total models in the unit, and no single model can suffer more than one hit from each Area Attack.

Remember that attacks multiplied into several hits are allocated after establishing how many its are scored (i.e. after the attack has hit).

Figure figure/areaattack illustrates different variations of Area Attack.

Examples of Area Attacks. Units A to D are hit by an Area Attack (33) that has their Front as its Target Facing.\ A: There are 3 ranks with more than 3 models. Number of hits: 3 + 3 + 3 = 9.\ B: The first rank has more than 3 models, but the second rank only has 2 models. There is no third rank. Number of hits: 3 + 2 = 5.\ C: Since there is only a single model, there will always only be a single rank with a single model. Number of hits: 1.\ D: The first and second rank have 3 models. There is no third rank. Number of hits: 3 + 3 = 6.\\ Units E and F are hit by an Area Attack (14).\ E: The attack has the Front of the unit as its Target Facing. The first and second rank have more than 1 model. There is no third or fourth rank. Number of hits: 1 + 1 = 2.\ F: The attack has the Flank of the unit as its Target Facing. There are more than 4 files with 1 or more models. Number of hits: 1 + 1 +1 +1 = 4.

rulebook-automatic_hits.title: Automatic Hits
rulebook-automatic_hits.def:
An attack with Automatic Hits does not roll to hit, but always hits automatically.

This rule is shortened to Auto when used as a weapon’s Aim.

rulebook-crush_attack.title: Crush Attack
rulebook-crush_attack.def: When a model part with Crush Attack allocates its attacks in Combat, it may choose to exchange all of its Standard Melee Attacks for a single Standard Melee Attack, which has its Strength and Armour Penetration both set to 10 and gains Multiple Wounds(D3). This cannot be done as a Restricted Attack.

rulebook-devastating_charge.title: Devastating Charge
rulebook-devastating_charge.def:
A Charging model part with Devastating Charge, or using a weapon with Devastating Charge, gains the Rules and Characteristic modifiers stated in brackets.

For example, a model part with Devastating Charge(+1 Str) gains +1 Str when Charging.

rulebook-direct_hit.title: Direct Hit
rulebook-direct_hit.def:
When an attack with Direct Hit hits, after determining the number of hits (e.g. in the case of Area Attack), a single hit, chosen by the attacker, gains the Rules and Characteristic modifiers stated in brackets.

If a Strength and/or Armour Penetration is given directly, set the attack’s Strength and/or Armour Penetration to that value (for example, Direct Hit (Str 10, AP 6) means one hit from that attack has its Strength set to 10 and its Armour Penetration set to 6
.

rulebook-divine_attacks.title: Divine Attacks
rulebook-divine_attacks.def: Aegis Saves cannot be taken against Divine Attacks.

rulebook-elven_finesse.title: Elven Finesse
rulebook-elven_finesse.def: A model part with this Attack Attribute attacking with a Great Weapon strikes at -1 Agility instead of always at Agility 0.

rulebook-extra_support.title: Extra Support
rulebook-extra_support.def: A model part with Extra Support replaces the limit on the maximum number of attacks the model can do as Restricted Attacks with the value in brackets (X) or, if it includes a +, increases that limit with +X.

rulebook-fight_in_extra_rank.title: Fight in Extra Rank
rulebook-fight_in_extra_rank.def: A model part with Fight in Extra Rank, or using a weapon with Fight in Extra Rank, can make Supporting Attacks from one additional rank.

rulebook-first_strike.title: First Strike
rulebook-first_strike.def:
During its First Round of Combat, any model part with First Strike, or using a weapon with First Strike, gains the Rules and Characteristic modifiers stated in brackets.

For example, a model part with First Strike(+1 Str) gains +1 Str in its First Round of Combat.

rulebook-flaming_attacks.title: Flaming Attacks
rulebook-flaming_attacks.def: Regeneration Saves cannot be taken against Flaming Attacks.

rulebook-lightning_attacks.title: Lightning Attacks
rulebook-lightning_attacks.def: Lightning Attacks must reroll failed to-wound rolls towards models without Metal Armour.

rulebook-fury.title: Fury
rulebook-fury.def: If the attack hits with a to-hit roll of ‘6’, it causes one additional hit (usually this means it causes two hits instead of one). This additional hit is allocated towards the same target.

rulebook-hatred.title: Hatred
rulebook-hatred.def: An attack with Hatred must reroll failed to-hit rolls.

rulebook-handandahalf.title: Hand-and-a-Half
rulebook-handandahalf.def: The model part ignores Two-Handed, and its weapons count as a Hand Weapon for the purpose of Shield (while keeping other rules and modifiers).

rulebook-lethal_strike.title: Lethal Strike
rulebook-lethal_strike.def: If an attack with Lethal Strike wounds with a to-wound roll of ‘6’, its Armour Penetration is always 10, and Regeneration Saves cannot be taken against it.

rulebook-magical_attacks.title: Magical Attacks
rulebook-magical_attacks.def: This Attack Attribute does not confer any direct effects, but instead interacts with other rules, such as Aegis(X, against Magical Attacks).

rulebook-march_and_shoot.title: March and Shoot
rulebook-march_and_shoot.def: Performing a March Move in the same Player Turn does not prevent shooting with attacks or model parts that have March and Shoot. (The the attack can still suffer -1 to hit for Moving and Shooting).

rulebook-multiple_wounds.title: Multiple Wounds
rulebook-multiple_wounds.def:
Health Point losses caused by the attack are multiplied into the value given in brackets (X).
If the value is a dice, roll one dice for each unsaved wound from an attack with Multiple Wounds.

The number of Health Point losses that the attack is multiplied into can never be higher than the Health Points Characteristic of the target (excluding Health Points lost previously in the battle).

For example, if an attack with Multiple Wounds(D6) wounds a unit of Trolls (HP 3) and rolls a ‘5’ for the multiplier, the number of Health Points lost is reduced to 3, even if the Troll unit has already lost one or two Health Points previously in battle.

rulebook-poison_attacks.title: Poison Attacks
rulebook-poison_attacks.def:
Whenever an attack with Poison Attacks hits with a to-hit roll of ‘6’, it wounds automatically (no to-wound roll needed).

If the attack has two or more instances of Poison Attacks, it wounds automatically on a successful to-hit roll of ‘5’ or ‘6’ instead.

If the attack is turned into more than one hit (e.g. a hit with Area Attack, Fury), only a single hit, chosen by the attacker, wounds automatically. All other hits must roll to wound as normal.

rulebook-press_of_ranks.title: Press of Ranks
rulebook-press_of_ranks.def: An attack with Press of Ranks gains +1 to wound, to a maximum of 3+.

rulebook-psychic_attacks.title: Psychic Attacks
rulebook-psychic_attacks.def: When rolling to wound with a Psychic Attack, replace the target’s Resilience with its Discipline.

rulebook-quick_to_fire.title: Quick to Fire
rulebook-quick_to_fire.def: An attack with Quick to Fire does not suffer the -1 to-hit modifier for Moving and Shooting.

rulebook-rage.title: Rage
rulebook-rage.def:
Whenever the model loses a Health Point, it gains +1 Att.

Whenever it Recovers or Raises a Health Point, it suffers -1 Att

rulebook-shoot_in_extra_rank.title: Shoot in Extra Rank
rulebook-shoot_in_extra_rank.def:
A model part with Shoot in Extra Rank may use Shooting Attacks from one additional rank.

Normally, this means that it will be able to make Shooting Attacks from the third rank.

rulebook-toxic_attacks.title: Toxic Attacks
rulebook-toxic_attacks.def: An attack with Toxic Attack has always Strength 3, Armour Penetration 10, and Unmodifiable.

rulebook-twohanded.title: Two-Handed
rulebook-twohanded.def: A model part using a Two-Handed Melee Weapon cannot simultaneously use a Shield against Melee Attacks (unless it has Hand-and-a-Half).

rulebook-unmodifiable.title: Unmodifiable
rulebook-unmodifiable.def: Attacks and Attack Attributes with Unmodifiable are never affected by spells, Magic Items or other Model Rules from friendly models, unless explicitly stated otherwise.

rulebook-unwieldy.title: Unwieldy
rulebook-unwieldy.def: If the model performed a Move Manoeuvre in the current Player Turn, any attacks it makes that have Unwieldy suffer -X to hit. This modifier can be combined with the -1 to-hit modifier from Moving and Shooting.

rulebook-weapon_master.title: Weapon Master
rulebook-weapon_master.def:
The model part may choose what Melee Weapon to use in each Round of Combat, instead of only in the .

.

All Rank-and-File models in a unit still need to choose the same weapon.
The model part may also choose to use a Hand Weapon or Innate Weapons even if it has other Melee Weapons (but if armed with an Enchanted Weapon, the model part must still use it).

rulebook-zeal.title: Zeal
rulebook-zeal.def: An attack with Zeal must reroll failed to-wound rolls.

rulebook-breath_attack.title: Breath Attack
rulebook-breath_attack.def: Range 8", Shots: 2D6, Str: X, AP: X, One use only. March and Shoot. Hits automatically (no to-hit roll required). The Strength, Armour Penetration, and additional Attack Attributes are defined in brackets (X).

rulebook-grind_attack.title: Grind Attack
rulebook-grind_attack.def:
A model part with a Grind Attack can make a Special Attack which is resolved at the model part’s Agility, and inflicts X hits, using the model part’s Strength, Armour Penetration, and Attack Attributes, but not Weapons.

Remember that attacks multiplied into several hits are allocated after establishing how many hits are scored (i.e. after the attack has hit).

rulebook-impact_hits.title: Impact Hits
rulebook-impact_hits.def:
If Charging, the model part can make a Special Attack which is resolved at Agility Step 10, and inflicts X hits, using the model part’s Strength, Armour Penetration, and Attack Attributes, but not Weapons.

Remember that attacks multiplied into several hits are allocated after establishing how many hits are scored (i.e. after the attack has hit).

If more than one model part of a combined model has Impact Hits, only a single model part (chosen by the model’s owner) can perform its Impact Hits in a Round of Combat.

rulebook-stomp_attack.title: Stomp Attack
rulebook-stomp_attack.def:
A model part with Stomp Attack can make a Special Attack which is resolved at Agility Step 0, can only be allocated towards a Health Pool of Height 0–1, and inflicts X hits, using the model part’s Strength, Armour Penetration and Attack Attributes, but not Weapons.


If more than one model part of a combined model has Stomp Attack, only a single model part (chosen by the model’s owner) can perform its Stomp Attack in each Round of Combat.

rulebook-sweeping_attack.title: Sweeping Attack
rulebook-sweeping_attack.def:
When a model with Sweeping Attack is within 1" of an Unengaged enemy unit during a Move Manoeuvre (even temporarily), the model’s unit may perform a Sweeping Attack against that enemy unit. This can only be used once per friendly Player Turn.

Resolve the Sweeping Attack when the Move Manoeuvre is completed. The attack hits automatically, and counts as a Ranged Attack.

Each model part in the unit with Sweeping Attack must use it towards the same enemy unit. The attack causes X hits, resolved with the model part’s Strength, Armour Penetration and Attack Attributes, but not Weapons.

If values for Strength, Armour Penetration and additional Attack Attributes are defined in the bracket (Y), these are used instead. In this case, the Sweeping Attack is Unmodifiable.

rulebook-standard_melee_attacks.title: Standard Melee Attacks
rulebook-standard_melee_attacks.def:
Standard Melee Attacks

The most common type of attack in the Melee Phase is the Standard Melee Attack, which all models can perform provided they have an Attack Value on their profile (see Characteristic Profiles in the Definitions and Terminology chapter).
To resolve these attacks, roll a number of D6 equal to the Attack Value of the attacking model part. This is called a to-hit roll.

Compare the attacking model part’s Offensive Skill with the target model’s Defensive Skill and check the table below to know which result is needed on the dice roll to score a successful hit.

A roll of ‘1’ is always a failure, and a roll of ‘6’ is always a success.
Both tables present the same relation, visualised in different ways.

Offensive Skill –
Defensive Skill		 Result needed to hit
4 or more 2+
1 to 3 3+
-3 to 0 4+
-4 or less 5+


Once you have determined the number of hits, follow the Attack Sequence (described in the Attacks chapter), using the Strength, Armour Penetration, and on the profile of the attacking model part, potentially modified by things like weapons, spells and Model Rules.

Off 1 Off 2 Off 3 Off 4 Off 5 Off 6 Off 7 Off 8 Off 9 Off 10
Def 1 4+ 3+ 3+ 3+ 2+ 2+ 2+ 2+ 2+ 2+
Def 2 4+ 4+ 3+ 3+ 3+ 2+ 2+ 2+ 2+ 2+
Def 3 4+ 4+ 4+ 3+ 3+ 3+ 2+ 2+ 2+ 2+
Def 4 4+ 4+ 4+ 4+ 3+ 3+ 3+ 2+ 2+ 2+
Def 5 5+ 4+ 4+ 4+ 4+ 3+ 3+ 3+ 2+ 2+
Def 6 5+ 5+ 4+ 4+ 4+ 4+ 3+ 3+ 3+ 2+
Def 7 5+ 5+ 5+ 4+ 4+ 4+ 4+ 3+ 3+ 3+
Def 8 5+ 5+ 5+ 5+ 4+ 4+ 4+ 4+ 3+ 3+
Def 9 5+ 5+ 5+ 5+ 5+ 4+ 4+ 4+ 4+ 3+
Def 10 5+ 5+ 5+ 5+ 5+ 5+ 4+ 4+ 4+ 4+

rulebook-infantry.title: Infantry
rulebook-infantry.def: Infantry does not grant additional Model Rules

rulebook-construct.title: Construct
rulebook-construct.def: The model cannot use  and has

rulebook-standard_bearer.title: Standard Bearer
rulebook-standard_bearer.def:
Standard Bearer is a unit-wide upgrade, normally represented by the presence of a model carrying the unit standard, icon, military insignia, totem, or other similar symbol.

A unit containing a Standard Bearer adds +1 to the Combat Score of its side.
